message: Nice post,  http://dear-apple.com/itunes-is-running-the-asylum anybody else is pissed off by iTunes?
yeah, itunes could do a better job in that situation
For a man who values quality so much, Steve Jobs has sure let iTunes for Windows turn into a total piece of crap.
@Lloyd yes, but who uses Windows anymore?
I agree, aside from stability issues, I have found with my Itunes that formatting as far as text and buttons has been a bit wonky on windows 7
Actually I believe there is a dedicated department at Apple that produces worsened versions of their products for windows users.
I use iTunes to manage podcast subscriptions but I listen to more music using Amazon Cloud player these days.
@Lloyd that is never happening so keep wishing
I wish Apple would release an iTunes-light: no store, just the ability to sync iPad/iPhones
Apple would be smart to make the iTunes for Windows experience an incredible one. For most PC users, iTunes is their intro to Apple. They can either make it a gateway drug, or a user-repellant.
iTunes for windows is horrible, for Mac it is awesome.
I really don't like iTunes, but I don't have a choice but to deal with it since I have to use it for syncing my iDevices.
i'm a bit surprised apple hasn't just integrated the whole i-device management thing into the operating system
I suppose they want to keep it consistent across platforms
I'm sure Apple does what it can to make iTunes work well on Windows, but Microsoft is pretty good at using strategic incompetence to make competitor programs not work as well as they could
